paper.title: Probabilistic analysis of an anonymity system

author.org: SRI International, 333 Ravenswood Avenue, Menlo Park, CA 94025, USA E-mail: shmat@csl.sri.com#TAB#

paper.abstract: We use the probabilistic model checker PRISM to analyze the Crowds system for anonymous Web browsing. This case study demonstrates how probabilistic model checking techniques can be used to formally analyze security properties of a peer-to-peer group communication system based on random message routing among members. The behavior of group members and the adversary is modeled as a discrete-time Markov chain, and the desired security properties are expressed as PCTL formulas. The PRISM model checker is used to perform automated analysis of the system and verify anonymity guarantees it provides.
